title: Datenanfragen.de company database record
description:
A single record of the Datenanfragen.de company database. It represents the contact information of a company (or other organization) specifically for GDPR requests.
More information and access to the whole database at: https://github.com/datenanfragen/data
Reference with full descriptions of all fields: https://github.com/datenanfragen/data/blob/master/docs/reference/companies.md

slug.title: Slug
slug.description: A unique identifier for the company record.

relevant-countries.title: Relevant countries
relevant-countries.description: A list of countries the record is relevant for.

categories.title: Categories
categories.description: A list of categories that the company fits into.

name.description: The name of the company or service, usually the company's official name.
name.title: Name

runs.title: Runs
runs.description: A list of other services and companies the parent company is responsible (as defined in Article 4(7) GDPR) for.

address.title: Address
address.description: The address where the company can be reached for GDPR requests.

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: A phone number where the company can be reached for GDPR requests.

fax.title: Fax
fax.description: A fax number where the company can be reached for GDPR requests.

email.title: Email
email.description: An email address where the company can be reached for GDPR requests.

webform.title: Web form
webform.description: A URL to a web form where the company can be reached for GDPR requests.

pgp-fingerprint.title: PGP fingerprint
pgp-fingerprint.description: Fingerprint of the PGP key of the email address used to send GDPR requests to the company.

pgp-url.title: PGP URL
pgp-url.description: URL, where the PGP key of the email address used to send GDPR requests to the company can be downloaded.

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: A list of sources for the record. Preferably from the company's official website.

required-elements.title: Required elements
required-elements.description: A list of identification elements the user has to provide for requests to the company.

desc.title: Description
desc.description: A clear label for the identification element.

optional.title: Optional?
optional.description: Whether the identification element is optional. Default is `false`.

request-language.title: Request language
request-language.description: The language requests to the company should be in.

custom-access-template.title: Custom access template
custom-access-template.description: The path to a custom template for data access requests to this company, if necessary.

custom-erasure-template.title: Custom erasure template
custom-erasure-template.description: The path to a custom template for data erasure requests to this company, if necessary.

custom-rectification-template.title: Custom rectification template
custom-rectification-template.description: The path to a custom template for data rectification requests to this company, if necessary.

custom-objection-template.title: Custom objection template
custom-objection-template.description: The path to a custom template for direct marketing objection requests to this company, if necessary.

needs-id-document.title: Needs ID document?
needs-id-document.description: Whether an ID document is necessary for all requests to this company.

suggested-transport-medium.title: Suggested transport medium
suggested-transport-medium.description: The transport medium a user should use for their GDPR requests.

comments.title: Comments
comments.description: A list of notes relevant to the record.

quality.title: Quality
quality.description: The quality of the record based on how it was compiled.

facet-group.title: Facet group
facet-group.description: If the record falls into one of the listed groups, choose that one. Otherwise, leave this field blank.

nsfw.title: NSFW
nsfw.description: Is this company “not safe for work“, i.e. does it offer content or services that fall under applicable youth protection laws and are only meant for adults? Only set if `true`.
